title: How is the clan tag "ISIS" allowed and not bannable?
body:
Take action on this. 

its beyond a joke what you can get away with on OCE.

replies.body:
Should people named Isis also be arrested for having the name?

Banning people over that name is just giving them more power.

it was a name before ISIS was a thing and it should stay that way
I think that's one that would depend on the club name as well, since ISIS has a lot of other uses/meanings. You can always report the name though.
So does the same apply for F A G?

To a lesser extent, but yes I would say so. It likely comes down to believably. It's entirely believable that someone names their club after the Egyptian goddess because they love the mythology, less so that someone called their club f a g because they really like cigarettes.

Even going beyond the context of a club tag, it would be more likely for people to be using "Isis" (such as calling someone by their name, or referring to the goddess) than it would be for someone to be using the term "f\*g" to refer to cigarettes out of context, such as during general chat use in a video game (as I understand it, it's rare for anyone to refer to cigarettes as "f\*gs" out of context, even in real life).

I mean we aren't in the UK, so it's barely even accepted slang for cigarette for most of us on OCE. I can't say I'd be very convinced if someone told me "it's just slang for cigarette, I think smoking is hilarious so I made it my club tag!"

^ This. So much this.

FUN FACT: Among the various uses of the term/phrase/name "Isis", there is the [Egyptian Goddess Isis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isis), who is believed to have helped the dead enter the afterlife, and pre-dates the Islamic terrorist group known as "ISIS" (a name given by an american, mind you) by about 5000+ years.
If you find a club name inappropriate, hit the inappropriate name box, then write a note about the club name.
